results.title: Israeli boy: life on a kibbutz
results.creator_credit: Ruth Broyde and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Differing in their degree of adherence to pioneer customs, in their size, in what they produce and in the philosophy that unites each membership, the kibbutzim of Israel are greatly diverse. Here, a young Israeli boy describes life as it is on his particular kibbutz where the children are raised apart from their parents but retain close family ties. Nir explains how his kibbutz operates and tells about his family’s role on the kibbutz.

results.title: Israel: an adventure
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Franta G. Herman, Nathan Kroll and Israel Government Tourist Office
results.brief_description: A kaleidoscopic tour of Israel where the past, present and future lie open side by side: Acre, where Jew and Arab work peacefully side by side; the modern city of Haifa with its harbour, industries and big blocks of flats; the Catacombs, Hebrew University; Jerusalem with its churches from many countries and a Yemenite wedding rehearsal. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Israel
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, Walter J. Carroll and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: The controversial history of the Jews from the time of the Patriarchs to the destruction of the Temple and the dispersion to the fourn corners of the earth. In exile the Jews kept their faith alive, through persecution and ppgrom, until the fateful events of World War II ultimately led to the re-establishment of Israel as a nation. Includes documentary footage from 1900-1948, animated footage, and concludes with a colorful spectrum of present day conditions (1965). Animation sequence designed, written and directed by Philip Stapp.

results.title: Isotopes in action
results.creator_credit: Ken McCready, Sidney Goldsmith and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Radioactive isotopes serve in many different ways—in preservation of food, in strengthening of plastics, in industry, medicine and agriculture. Here is a fascinating exploration, in layman’s language, of what they can do. The film shows the reactors at Canada’s Chalk River nuclear laboratories, the composition and function of cobalt 60, and developments in atomic science. (Awards: London; Buenos Aires; Rome)

results.title: Isle of spice
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures and Van Beuren Corporation
results.brief_description: Short travelogue focusing on the island of Ceylon (now Sri Lanka). We are briefly introduced to various customs of the locals, and we see footage of activities such as fishing, the use of elephants to aid in heavy work, lacemaking and the coconut harvesting. Contains footage of 1930s Colombo.

results.title: Isle of bounty
results.creator_credit: Frank Coffey, Australian National Film Board and Movietonenews
results.brief_description: A study of the sub-tropical island where some of the crew of the famous Bounty mutiny settled and married Polynesian wives - Norfolk Island, one of the many Pacific Islands north-east of Australia.

results.title: Islands under the wind: Tahiti
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss, Henry Strauss Productions and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: The leisurely life of the people of Tahiti and in particular the township of Papeete is depicted. Marketing, boating, fishing, dancing and going to church make up the lives of a people who work to live rather than live to work. The beautiful scenery of a typical tropical island forms a background to the dances and music of the islanders. Although, also showing the coconut industry, spear fishing and diving for pearl shell, the film primarily emphasises the scenic attractions and the easy life on the island. Narrated by Claude Dauphin.

results.title: Island of turtles
results.creator_credit: Noel Monkman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Turtles are found in the seas around the islands of the Great Barrier Reef, Queensland. Living most of its life in water the female turtle comes to land to lay her eggs in the sandy shores. After 9-10 weeks the eggs hatch out and the young turtles make their way to the sea. Also shows crested terns and other sea birds on the islands. Additional photography by C.P. Mountford.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Monkman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Island of silence
results.brief_description: Due to raids and clan wars on Easter Island in the 18th and 19th centuries, the men descending from earlier generations died out. Huge sculptures whose origin and meaning are a mystery remain from an earlier strange civilization. Juxtaposes scenes of present day craftsmen and other islanders with the heroic vision depicted in the sculptures.

results.title: Island link
results.brief_description: In March of 1957, the cable linking Tasmania with the mainland was broken. This film shows the operations necessary to locate the break and raise, repair and re-lay the submarine cable in Bass Strait.
results.description: In March of 1957, the cable linking Tasmania with the mainland was broken. This film shows the operations necessary to locate the break and raise, repair and re-lay the submarine cable in Bass Strait.
